pages.text: Pteraspis was an agnathan(jawless) fish from the Devonian with protective armor covering its upper body and head. At the tip of its head was also a pointed protrusion as well as wing-like protrusions on the sides of its body. Pteraspis was very streamlined, making it a good swimmer and it is thought to have fed off plankton just under the ocean surface.
